Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include different kinds of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or bushes on land and aquatic plants in water.
The student can include different kinds of animals in each habitat, such as squirrels, ants, or lizards on land and fish or clams in water.
The student can make comparisons by illustrating how the types of living things differ between the two habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show the diversity of life in both habitats.
